name: Emergency Plumbing
shortDescription: 24/7 emergency plumbing services for urgent repairs, burst pipes, and plumbing disasters.
longDescription:
When plumbing disasters strike at 2 AM or during holiday gatherings, Wood's Plumbing is your lifeline. Our emergency plumbers understand that every minute counts when water is flooding your home or sewage is backing up into your bathroom. We maintain a dedicated fleet of fully-equipped service vehicles stationed throughout Southern Arizona, enabling response times that minimize damage and restore normalcy quickly.

Unlike companies that charge premium rates for after-hours calls, we believe emergencies shouldn't cost you extra. Our transparent pricing applies 24/7, whether it's a Sunday morning or New Year's Eve. Our technicians carry specialized equipment including high-powered extraction tools, pipe freezing kits for live-line repairs, and thermal imaging cameras to locate hidden leaks behind walls.

From burst supply lines flooding basements to failed water heaters threatening electrical systems, our emergency team has handled every scenario during 46+ years serving Tucson, Marana, Oro Valley, and surrounding communities. We coordinate with restoration companies when needed and document damage for insurance claims. When seconds matter, trust the plumber who answers the phone and shows up fast.
benefits: Guaranteed response within 60 minutes for critical emergencies
Same rates 24/7—no overtime or holiday surcharges ever
GPS-dispatched trucks positioned throughout Southern Arizona
Pipe freezing technology for live-line repairs without water shutoff
Thermal imaging cameras locate hidden leaks behind walls and floors
Direct coordination with water damage restoration companies
Insurance documentation and photography for claims assistance
46 years of emergency experience across 50,000+ service calls

process.title: Immediate Phone Triage
process.description: Our emergency dispatcher answers your call within seconds, asks targeted questions to assess severity, and provides immediate guidance to minimize damage while help is en route—like where to find your main shutoff valve.

process.title: Rapid GPS Dispatch
process.description: We locate the nearest available technician using real-time GPS tracking, routing them directly to your location. Most emergency calls see a plumber on-site within 30-60 minutes.

process.title: Damage Mitigation First
process.description: Before discussing costs, our plumber focuses on stopping active water flow, preventing electrical hazards, and protecting your property from further damage. Safety and damage control come first.

process.title: Transparent Emergency Pricing
process.description: Once the immediate crisis is contained, we provide a clear quote for permanent repair. No surprises—the price we quote is the price you pay, regardless of how long the repair takes.

process.title: Complete Restoration & Documentation
process.description: We complete the repair, test all systems, document the damage and repairs with photos for your insurance, and ensure your plumbing is fully functional before leaving.

name: Drain Cleaning
shortDescription: Professional drain cleaning for kitchen, bathroom, and floor drains.
longDescription:
Slow drains and recurring clogs aren't just inconvenient—they're warning signs of larger problems developing in your plumbing system. Wood's Plumbing uses advanced drain cleaning technology that goes far beyond the chemical solutions and basic snakes that only provide temporary relief. Our approach eliminates the clog AND the conditions that caused it.

We begin every drain cleaning with a thorough camera inspection to understand exactly what we're dealing with. Is it grease buildup from kitchen use? Tree roots infiltrating your sewer line? Years of mineral scale narrowing your pipes? Each situation requires a different solution. Our hydro-jetting equipment delivers up to 4,000 PSI of water pressure, scouring pipe walls clean and restoring full flow capacity—something no chemical or cable machine can achieve.

For kitchen drains plagued by grease, bathroom drains clogged with hair and soap scum, or main sewer lines blocked by debris, our technicians have the right tool for every situation. We also identify potential problems before they become emergencies, like developing root intrusions or deteriorating pipe sections. Serving Tucson and Southern Arizona for over four decades, we've cleared millions of feet of drains and can handle everything from a slow bathroom sink to a completely blocked commercial sewer main.
benefits: HD camera inspection reveals the exact cause and location of clogs
Hydro-jetting at 4,000 PSI scours pipes clean—not just punches through
Removes grease, roots, mineral scale, and years of buildup completely
Identifies developing problems before they cause emergencies
Safe for all pipe types including older clay and cast iron lines
Environmentally friendly—no harsh chemicals enter the water system
Restores original pipe diameter and flow capacity
Preventive maintenance plans keep drains flowing year-round

process.title: Video Camera Diagnosis
process.description: We insert a high-definition waterproof camera into your drain to see exactly what's causing the blockage—whether it's grease buildup, tree roots, collapsed pipe, or foreign objects. This prevents guesswork and ensures the right solution.

process.title: Blockage Assessment Report
process.description: Based on camera findings, we explain what we discovered, show you the footage on our tablet, and recommend the most effective cleaning method for your specific situation.

process.title: Professional Drain Clearing
process.description: Using the appropriate equipment—motorized cable machines for minor clogs, high-pressure hydro-jetting for heavy buildup and roots—we completely clear the obstruction and restore full drainage.

process.title: Post-Cleaning Verification
process.description: We run the camera through again after cleaning to confirm the drain is completely clear and inspect for any damage or developing issues that could cause future problems.

process.title: Prevention Recommendations
process.description: Based on what caused your clog, we provide specific tips to prevent recurrence and can recommend a maintenance schedule for drains prone to buildup, like kitchen lines in heavy-use homes.

name: Whole House Repiping
shortDescription: Complete home repiping with modern PEX or copper piping.
longDescription:
When your home's pipes reach the end of their lifespan, repairs become a game of whack-a-mole—fix one leak, another appears. Whole-house repiping replaces your entire water supply system with modern materials designed to last 50+ years, eliminating the cycle of recurring repairs and giving you peace of mind for decades.

Wood's Plumbing has repiped hundreds of Southern Arizona homes, from 1950s ranch houses with deteriorating galvanized steel to 1980s homes with failing polybutylene. We specialize in minimally-invasive repiping techniques that preserve your walls, ceilings, and landscaping. Using flexible PEX tubing, we can often route new supply lines through existing pathways, requiring far fewer wall openings than traditional rigid copper installations.

Our repiping crews work systematically room by room, typically completing an average home in 2-3 days. We coordinate with drywall contractors and painters if needed, managing the entire project so you deal with one company from start to finish. The result is consistent water pressure throughout your home, elimination of rusty discolored water, and protection against the flooding that aging pipes inevitably cause. We'll help you understand the warning signs that indicate repiping is necessary and provide a detailed assessment of your current plumbing system.
benefits: Eliminates recurring leaks and the damage they cause
Modern PEX piping carries 50+ year manufacturer warranties
Minimally-invasive techniques reduce wall and ceiling repairs
Restores full water pressure lost to corroded galvanized pipes
Ends rusty, discolored water from deteriorating steel lines
Flexible PEX resists freezing better than rigid copper
Single-source project management from pipes to wall repair
Increases home value and eliminates buyer concerns about old plumbing

process.title: Comprehensive Plumbing Assessment
process.description: We inspect your entire water supply system, identify all problem areas, test water pressure at multiple points, and determine the scope of work needed. We'll explain why repiping is recommended versus continued repairs.

process.title: Custom Installation Design
process.description: Our team designs the new piping layout to optimize water pressure and minimize wall penetrations. We identify the least invasive routing paths and plan the installation sequence room by room.

process.title: Systematic Room-by-Room Installation
process.description: We work through your home methodically, replacing old pipes with new PEX supply lines. We install modern ball-valve shutoffs at each fixture, enabling easy future maintenance without shutting off the whole house.

process.title: Pressure Testing & Inspection
process.description: Before closing any walls, we pressure-test the entire new system to verify zero leaks. We photograph all connections for your records and conduct a final walkthrough to confirm every fixture has strong, clean water flow.

process.title: Wall Repair Coordination
process.description: We patch all access holes we created and can coordinate drywall finishing and painting through our network of trusted contractors—one point of contact for your complete repiping project.

name: Water Conditioning
shortDescription: Comprehensive water treatment solutions for better water quality.
longDescription:
Southern Arizona's water is among the hardest in the nation, with mineral content that destroys appliances, clogs pipes, and leaves stubborn deposits on everything it touches. Wood's Plumbing installs and services water conditioning systems that transform harsh desert water into the soft, clean water your home deserves.

Hard water costs you money in ways you might not realize. Water heaters fail years early because calcium scale insulates heating elements, forcing them to work harder and eventually burn out. Dishwashers and washing machines clog with mineral deposits. Faucets and showerheads need constant replacement. Your skin and hair suffer from the drying effects of mineral-laden water. A properly sized water conditioning system eliminates all of these problems.

We offer multiple conditioning technologies to match your water quality, usage patterns, and preferences. Traditional salt-based softeners remain the most effective for extremely hard water. Salt-free conditioning systems prevent scale without adding sodium, ideal for those on low-sodium diets. Whole-house filtration removes chlorine taste and odor. We test your water, analyze your usage, and recommend the right system—then handle professional installation and teach you simple maintenance. With decades of experience with Tucson's unique water chemistry, we size systems correctly the first time.
benefits: Extends water heater lifespan by 5-8 years by preventing scale buildup
Eliminates spotted dishes, shower doors, and fixtures
Reduces soap and detergent usage by up to 50%
Protects pipes and appliances from damaging mineral deposits
Softer skin and more manageable hair from scale-free water
Multiple technologies available: salt-based, salt-free, and filtration
Custom sizing based on actual water testing and household usage
Local service and maintenance for all major conditioning brands

process.title: Professional Water Testing
process.description: We test your water for hardness, iron content, pH, chlorine, and other factors that affect water quality. This analysis determines exactly what conditioning equipment your home needs.

process.title: Usage Analysis & System Sizing
process.description: Based on your household size, water usage patterns, and test results, we recommend the appropriately sized system. Undersized systems fail prematurely; oversized systems waste salt and water.

process.title: Technology Selection
process.description: We explain the pros and cons of different conditioning technologies for your situation—traditional softeners, salt-free conditioners, whole-house filtration, or combination systems—so you can make an informed choice.

process.title: Professional Installation
process.description: Our technicians install your system to manufacturer specifications, including proper drainage, electrical connections if needed, and bypass valves for maintenance. We ensure optimal placement for easy salt filling and service.

process.title: Operation Training & Maintenance Setup
process.description: We walk you through system operation, show you how to add salt and check settings, and explain maintenance requirements. We can schedule annual service visits to keep your system performing optimally.

name: Gas Line Installation
shortDescription: Safe installation of gas lines for appliances and heating.
longDescription:
Converting to gas or extending gas service to new appliances requires precision work by licensed professionals. Gas line installation isn't a DIY project—improperly installed gas piping creates explosion and carbon monoxide risks that endanger your family. Wood's Plumbing holds the specialized licenses required for gas work in Arizona and follows strict safety protocols on every installation.

Whether you're running a new line for a gas range, connecting a backup generator, extending service to an outdoor grill or fire pit, or converting your water heater to more economical natural gas, our technicians have the expertise to do it right. We calculate pipe sizing based on total BTU demand, ensuring adequate gas flow to all appliances without pressure drops. We use only approved materials rated for natural gas or propane, and we leak-test every connection before putting the system in service.

Our gas line installations meet all local codes and pass inspection the first time. We coordinate with Southwest Gas for meter upgrades when needed and handle all permit applications. From the initial design through final inspection, you're working with one experienced team that takes full responsibility for a safe, code-compliant installation. Serving Southern Arizona for 46+ years, we've installed thousands of gas lines for homes and businesses throughout the region.
benefits: Licensed and certified for gas work under Arizona regulations
Proper BTU load calculations ensure adequate gas flow to all appliances
Only code-approved materials rated for natural gas and propane
Pressure testing and leak detection on every connection
Permit handling and inspection coordination included
Coordination with Southwest Gas for meter sizing and upgrades
Clean installation with proper support and protection
Written documentation for warranty and insurance records

process.title: Site Survey & BTU Calculation
process.description: We assess where the new gas line needs to run, measure distances, and calculate total BTU requirements based on all appliances that will use the line. This determines proper pipe sizing.

process.title: Code-Compliant Design
process.description: We design the piping route to meet all code requirements for clearances, support, and protection. If permits are required, we handle the application and schedule the inspection.

process.title: Professional Pipe Installation
process.description: Using properly sized black iron or CSST flexible gas piping, we install the new line with approved fittings and connections. All joints are secured and protected per manufacturer specifications.

process.title: Pressure Testing & Leak Detection
process.description: Before connecting any appliances, we pressure-test the new line and check every connection with gas-detection solution. The system must hold pressure and show zero leaks before we proceed.

process.title: Appliance Connection & System Verification
process.description: We connect your appliances, verify proper operation, check for correct flame patterns, and test safety shutoffs. We walk you through the new installation and provide documentation for your records.

name: Gas Leak Repair
shortDescription: Immediate response to gas leak emergencies.
longDescription:
The smell of gas in your home demands immediate action—gas leaks can cause explosions, fires, and deadly carbon monoxide poisoning. Wood's Plumbing provides emergency gas leak repair with the urgency these dangerous situations require. If you smell rotten eggs or sulfur, hear hissing near gas lines, or notice dead vegetation near buried gas lines, leave immediately and call us.

Our gas leak specialists carry advanced electronic detection equipment that locates leaks with pinpoint accuracy, even in buried lines or behind walls. Unlike the soap bubble test that only works on accessible fittings, our combustible gas detectors sense minute concentrations in the air, leading us directly to the source. Once located, we isolate the section, make the repair with approved materials, and retest to confirm the system is safe.

Not all gas leaks present obvious warning signs. Slow leaks at old corroded fittings or aging flexible connectors may not produce a noticeable odor until concentrations reach dangerous levels. If you have older gas piping or appliances, we recommend periodic inspection to identify problems before they become emergencies. Our technicians are licensed and trained specifically for gas work, following strict safety protocols that protect your family and property.
benefits: 24/7 emergency response for gas leak situations
Electronic combustible gas detectors pinpoint hidden leaks
Trained to locate leaks in buried lines and behind walls
Licensed specifically for gas line repair in Arizona
Repairs made with code-approved materials and techniques
Post-repair pressure testing confirms system integrity
Coordination with Southwest Gas for meter-side issues
Safety inspection identifies other potential problems

process.title: Emergency Safety Protocol
process.description: Upon arrival, we survey for immediate hazards, ensure ventilation, and verify the area is safe to work. If gas concentration is dangerous, we coordinate evacuation and contact the gas utility for meter shutoff.

process.title: Electronic Leak Detection
process.description: Using professional combustible gas detectors, we trace the leak to its exact source—whether at a visible fitting, behind drywall, or underground. We won't start repairs until we've found every leak point.

process.title: Isolation & Repair
process.description: We shut off gas to the affected section and make repairs using approved materials and techniques. Whether it's a corroded fitting, damaged flex connector, or cracked pipe, we replace the failed component completely.

process.title: Pressure Test & Verification
process.description: After repairs, we pressure-test the system and recheck with gas detectors to confirm zero leaks. We won't restore service until we're certain the system is completely safe.

process.title: System Safety Inspection
process.description: Before leaving, we inspect other gas connections and appliances for developing problems—catching potential future leaks while we're there. We document all work for your records and the gas company.

name: Gas Pipe Testing
shortDescription: Professional gas pipe pressure testing and leak detection to ensure safety and code compliance.
longDescription:
Gas pipe testing is a critical safety service that verifies the integrity of your gas piping system. Whether required for real estate transactions, after remodeling work, following earthquake activity, or as part of regular safety maintenance, professional pressure testing confirms that your gas lines are leak-free and safe to operate.

Wood's Plumbing performs gas pipe testing to the standards required by Arizona code and accepted by Southwest Gas. We isolate the gas piping from appliances, pressurize the system with air or inert gas, and monitor for pressure drop over a specified period. Even tiny leaks that wouldn't be detectable by smell show up as pressure loss during testing. If a leak is found, our detection equipment locates it precisely for repair.

Many home buyers now require gas pipe testing before purchase, and lenders may make it a condition of financing for older homes. Real estate agents throughout Tucson and Southern Arizona rely on Wood's Plumbing for fast, documented testing that satisfies transaction requirements. We also test gas systems after major renovation work, following seismic activity, and for businesses that require regular safety documentation. Our test reports include pressure readings, duration, and certification that the system meets code requirements.
benefits: Certified testing meets Arizona code and Southwest Gas requirements
Detects even microscopic leaks invisible to other methods
Documentation accepted for real estate transactions
Required testing for post-construction and renovation sign-off
Identifies problems before they become dangerous leaks
Electronic leak detection pinpoints any failures for repair
Fast scheduling accommodates real estate closing timelines
Written certification for permanent records and insurance

process.title: System Preparation
process.description: We turn off gas supply and isolate the piping from all appliances. Each appliance is disconnected from the test to ensure we're testing only the permanent piping—not appliance valves or flex connectors.

process.title: Pressurization
process.description: Using a calibrated pressure gauge, we pressurize the gas piping system to the required test pressure using air or nitrogen. The pressure is monitored for the code-required duration—typically 15-30 minutes.

process.title: Leak Determination
process.description: If pressure drops during the test period, the system has failed. We then use electronic detection equipment and approved leak detection solution to locate every leak point in the piping.

process.title: Repair If Needed
process.description: When leaks are found, we provide repair options and can make corrections using code-approved materials. After repairs, we repeat the pressure test to verify success.

process.title: Certification & Documentation
process.description: Upon successful testing, we provide written certification documenting the test procedure, pressures, duration, and results. This documentation satisfies requirements for real estate transactions, permits, and insurance.

name: Gas Line Relocation
shortDescription: Safe gas line relocation for remodels, additions, and outdoor kitchens.
longDescription:
Kitchen remodels, room additions, and appliance upgrades often require moving existing gas lines to new locations. Gas line relocation isn't simply extending a pipe—it requires proper sizing calculations, code-compliant routing, and professional-grade connections that will serve safely for decades. Wood's Plumbing handles gas line relocation projects from simple stove repositioning to complex whole-room reconfigurations.

When you move a gas stove across the kitchen, add a fireplace to a remodeled living room, or relocate your water heater to a new utility area, the gas supply must follow. Our technicians evaluate the entire gas system to ensure adequate capacity, then design and install new piping that maintains proper pressure to all appliances. We properly cap and abandon old line segments, meeting code requirements that prevent future confusion about active versus inactive piping.

Gas line relocation work requires permits in most Arizona jurisdictions, and we handle all permit applications and inspections as part of our service. Our experience with Tucson-area building departments means we know exactly what inspectors require and get approvals efficiently. After completing the relocation, we pressure-test the entire system and verify proper operation of all connected appliances. Whether you're working with a general contractor on a major renovation or handling a smaller project yourself, our gas specialists deliver safe, code-compliant results.
benefits: Proper sizing ensures adequate gas flow after relocation
Code-compliant routing meets all clearance and protection requirements
Old lines properly capped and marked as abandoned per code
Permit handling and inspection coordination included
Seamless coordination with your general contractor or remodeler
Minimal disruption to other renovation work in progress
Pressure testing verifies complete system integrity
Appliance reconnection and operation verification included

process.title: Project Consultation
process.description: We review your remodel plans to understand where appliances are moving and what gas capacity is needed. We identify the optimal route for new piping and plan how to tie into existing supply.

process.title: Permit & Coordination
process.description: We handle permit applications and coordinate timing with your general contractor or project schedule. Gas work typically needs to happen at specific construction phases for inspection access.

process.title: Old Line Capping
process.description: We properly cap and abandon gas lines at their source, clearly marking abandoned sections per code. This prevents confusion during future work and ensures old lines can never be accidentally reconnected.

process.title: New Line Installation
process.description: We install properly sized gas piping to the new appliance locations, with all connections made using approved materials and techniques. Support and protection meet code requirements for exposed and concealed piping.

process.title: Testing & Commissioning
process.description: After installation, we pressure-test the modified system, reconnect all appliances, verify proper operation, and schedule the required inspection. We document everything for your project records.
